Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Adjuvant Radiotherapy Plus Chemotherapy vs Chemotherapy Alone in Locally Advanced Bladder Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised phase 2 trial enrolled patients from December 2002 to July 2008 at an academic center.

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were ≤70 years with ≥pT3b, grade 3, or positive nodes, and negative margins post-RC.

Intervention.evidence: Interventions included chemotherapy plus RT (2 cycles of gemcitabine and cisplatin before and after RT) versus chemotherapy alone (4 cycles of gemcitabine and cisplatin).

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates if adjuvant radiotherapy (RT) plus chemotherapy improves locoregional recurrence-free survival (LRFS) compared to chemotherapy alone.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was LRFS over 2 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was weighted to speed accrual.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 120 patients were randomised: 75 to chemotherapy plus RT and 45 to chemotherapy alone.

Harms.evidence: RT-associated late grade 3 gastrointestinal adverse effects occurred in 7% of the chemotherapy plus RT group.
